author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the guidelines for auto-merging. Please make sure that you have read the [General registry README](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md) and the [AutoMerge guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/). The following guidelines were not met:

- Package name similar to 1 existing package.
  1. Similar to FileTrees. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

After you have fixed the AutoMerge issues, simple retrigger Registrator, which will automatically update this pull request. You do not need to change the version number in your `Project.toml` file (unless of course the AutoMerge issue is that you skipped a version number, in which case you should change the version number).

If you do not want to fix the AutoMerge issues, please post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have also read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

[noblock]
The reason the package couldn't be loaded was that `src/FileTypes.jl` doesn't exist. Renaming a package requires both a change of name in `Project.toml`, renaming the file loaded from `src`, and updating the name of the `module` created there.
Yes, I saw the failures, I will do the required changes and if I get stuck anywhere I will ask on slack.

Hi @GunnarFarneback 
Now, I have access to FileType Object but one of 4 public APIs provided by the lib is no longer working because of a type annotation issue 
`Is, matcher, is_extension_supported, is_mime_supported`

`matcher` is no longer working because of a type annotation issue

I am still a beginner to Julia, I need suggestions on the overall design  

I made an abstract type for all other types like Image, Font, and serval other filetype but I am not able to use it like an abstract type I am just using it as a placeholder for types like Image and all 

`ERROR: MethodError: Cannot `convert` an object of type FileTypes.FileType.Images.ABSType.Type to an object of type FileTypes.FileType.ABSType.Type`

```julia
julia> using FileTypes

julia> FileType
FileTypes.FileType

julia> FileType.Images.Image
Dict{FileTypes.FileType.Images.ABSType.Type, Function} with 12 entries:
  Type("jpg", MIME type image/jpeg)                => Jpeg
  Type("cr2", MIME type image/x-canon-cr2)         => CR2
  Type("webp", MIME type image/webp)               => Webp
  Type("jp2", MIME type image/jp2)                 => Jpeg2000
  Type("bmp", MIME type image/bmp)                 => Bmp
  Type("dwg", MIME type image/vnd.dwg)             => Dwg
  Type("psd", MIME type image/vnd.adobe.photoshop) => Psd
  Type("ico", MIME type image/vnd.microsoft.icon)  => Ico
  Type("jxr", MIME type image/vnd.ms-photo)        => Jxr
  Type("png", MIME type image/png)                 => Png
  Type("gif", MIME type image/gif)                 => Gif
  Type("tif", MIME type image/tiff)                => Tiff
```
one more thing
I want `FileType.Image` to return the above response instead of `FileType.Images.Image` if possible

this way I will be able to use `FileType.Image` instead of `FileType.Images.Image`. in the Types var of FileTypes.jl
`const Types=(FileType.Images.Image,FileType.Audios.Audio,FileType.Fonts.Font,FileType.Videos.Video,FileType.Applications.Application,FileType.Archives.Archive)`


Here is the link to the repo 
https://github.com/JuliaIO/FileTypes.jl

[noblock]
I can't say much about what would be a good design without understanding the functionality deeper but spontaneously I'd say that the module hierarchy is much too deep and repeatedly including a file which defines a module from within a variety of other modules is a bad idea as those modules will all be different ones.

[noblock]
Thanks for the good pointers @GunnarFarneback , I have changed the overall design.

body:
- Registering package: FileTypes
- Repository: https://github.com/JuliaIO/FileTypes.jl
- Created by: @Agent-Hellboy
- Version: v0.1.0
- Commit: ec2f472abba61537c37fff4aea9c1e06e7af1108
- Reviewed by: @Agent-Hellboy
- Reference: https://github.com/JuliaIO/FileTypes.jl/issues/2#issuecomment-1333036386
- Description: Small and dependency-free Julia package to infer file and MIME type checking the magic numbers signature.
<!--  -->
title: New package: FileTypes v0.1.0
